attributes.action: Introduce recall elections for MPs in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: In the United States, some states can recall representatives if they aren't fulfilling what they said they were going to do. Recall elections give the electorate a chance to make MPs more accountable and if they go astray from their promises can be replaced.

rejection.details:
There's already a UK law that allows for the recall of MPs in some circumstances. It's called the Recall of MPs Act 2015 and provides for a recall petition to be triggered if an MP is sentenced to a prison term or is suspended from the House for at least 21 sitting days.

You can find out more here:

https://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/__data/assets/pdf_file/0004/184324/Recall-Act-Factsheet.pdf

If you'd like this law to be changed, you could start a new petition explaining what specific changes you'd like to see.
